Descritpion: A new version Donkey Kong that featured all four levels of the original arcade game... And then 97 more. It went on to inspire the Mario vs Donkey Kong series on the GBA and DS.

Descritpion: 3 player isometric action game by Sega and released only in arcades. Loosely based upon the movie of the same name.

A scrolling platformer for the Nintendo Entertainment System developed by Hudson Soft, the game was an adaptation of the Westone/Sega arcade game Wonder Boy featuring an employee of Hudson wearing a grass skirt.

Descritpion: The main character in this classic side-scroller is Master Higgins who tries to save his girlfriend from the aliens that have invaded Adventure Island.

Descritpion: Lala has been captured again, this time by the king of Eggerland himself (AGAIN)! It's up to you (Lolo) to ascend his tower, confront evil, and put an end to this madness!

Video Game: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros.
Descritpion: All Night Nippon Super Mario Bros. is a version of the game based on the Japanese radio show All Night Nippon.

Descritpion: Journey as an Arabian prince to save the princess, who is imprisoned in the tower of a castle.

An Arabian-themed, side-scrolling beat-em-up released by Sega in 1991. Running on the 32-bit Sega System 32 arcade system, it featured four-player co-op gameplay and impressive psuedo-3D sprite-scaling effects.
Art of Fighting is SNK's second foray into the fighting game genre, known for its large character sprites and use of a super gauge.

Descritpion: A puzzle game featuring moles developed by Victor.

Play as lovable goofball Banjo the bear and his bird pal Kazooie in the first of many adventures as they collect valuable "Jiggies" in order to face the vile witch, Gruntilda and save Banjo's sister Tooty.

Descritpion: The first SNES entry in Rare's popular brawler series Battletoads, infamous both for its unique humor and brutal difficulty.

Descritpion: A wizard has turned Emilio into a jumpinh bean and kidnapped his girlfriend. Embark on a platforming adventure through fifty levels to save her.
The sequel to the original Shadowgate. ICOM developed it exclusively for the NEC TurboGrafx-CD. It was one of a handful of US exclusives for the system.
Booker's main objective is to rescue and protect Elizabeth, though she is perfectly capable of looking after herself.

Descritpion: Manipulate time to complete puzzles in this 2D platform game made by indie developer, Jonathan Blow.

Descritpion: A tilt-controlled action game for iOS devices, in which a bubble evades various types of irate birds to rescue a girl.
Cacoma Knight is a hybrid of action and puzzle elements. At the beginning you must choose between either Jack, Jean or RB93 as your character as you compete to purify the most land
An side-scrolling Action/RPG fantasy game.
Players go through the game rescuing 4 princesses.
Platform(s): Mac, Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, Browser

Video Game: Castle of Illusion starring Mickey Mouse
Descritpion: Minnie Mouse has been kidnapped by the evil witch Mizrabel, and it's up to Mickey Mouse to venture through the mysterious worlds of the Castle of Illusion to rescue her in this 2D platformer (and collaboration between Disney and Sega).

Descritpion: The second Castlevania installment for the Game Boy Advance, Castlevania: Harmony of Dissonance tells the tale of whip-bearing Juste Belmont, grandson of Simon Belmont.
Castlevania: Legacy of Darkness is a remastered version of Castlevania 64 that also features a new story and new characters. It has new stages as well as redesigned stages from the original.
Castlevania: Rondo of Blood is a traditional Castlevania platformer for the PC-Engine Super CD-ROM² that takes place before Castlevania: Symphony of the Night.

Dracula is still a threat in this updated version of Castlevania: Rondo of Blood, remade with 3D graphics for the Playstation Portable. Also included on the disc is the original PC-Engine Super CD-ROM2 version of Rondo of Blood as well as the sequel, Symphony of the Night.
After picking one of three opponents to fight, you must knock out all 32 teeth from your opponent to save a damsel in distress.
Caveman Chuck Rock must save his wife from dinosaurs by beating down enemies with his stomach and by hurling rocks in this side-scrolling action game.

Platform(s): Amiga, Game Boy, Game Gear, Genesis, Sega Master System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Sega CD, Amiga CD32, Acorn Archimedes

Descritpion: CID is a crash test dummy, take part in his adventures across wacky platforming stages to save a damsel in distress.
Alexander Zale embarks on a quest to start his own circus.
Clash at Demonhead is an action platformer for the NES featuring non-linear gameplay and an absurd story.
An insane Kickstarter-funded hardcore platformer by Pwnee Studios.
Platform Manufacturer(s): Apple, Microsoft, Sony, PC, Nintendo, Linux
Platform(s): Mac, Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, Nintendo 3DS eShop, Wii U, PlayStation Network (Vita), Linux

Descritpion: A platformer for the NES which is notable for allowing customization of the main character.

All was swell for the comic book artist and part-time rock musician Sketch Turner until his apartment got struck by lightning and he gets sucked into his own comic, where he has to fight off mutants and other monstrosities to save himself, as well as "the girl".
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, Genesis, Xbox 360 Games Store, Wii Shop, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC

Descritpion: Conan is an action adventure game that has you slicing and dicing your way through hordes of enemies.
An action-adventure title with some RPG elements, based on the Conan fiction. In it Conan is on a revenge hunt after high priest of the Cult of Set, Thoth Amon, massacres his wife and friends.
Several women have been kidnapped by a crime boss. It's your job to rescue them by beating up everyone in your way.
An action-RPG for the Neo Geo, notable for its unusual behind-the-back, one-on-one combat system.

As Nomad, an elite soldier outfitted in a state-of-the-art Nanosuit that gives him superhuman abilities, infiltrate a North Korean-held island to rescue captured scientists... and face a reawakening ancient evil that threatens the entire world. Crysis is well known for its high system requirements and top of the line graphics.
Platform(s): Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC

Descritpion: Traverse the nine circles of hell in EA's God of War clone named after the first cycle of Dante Alighieri's epic poem The Divine Comedy.
Platform(s): PlayStation Portable, Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, PlayStation Network (PS3), PlayStation Network (PSP)

Descritpion: Engineer Isaac Clarke battles a polymorphic virus-like alien infestation which turns human corpses into grotesque undead alien monsters called "Necromorphs", while trying to survive on board an infested interstellar mining ship named the USG Ishimura.
Platform(s): Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC

Descritpion: A first-person action-adventure game by Polish developer, Farm 51 and publisher, Nordic Games.

The fourth game in the popular Capcom action franchise, Devil May Cry. Take on the role of new playable character Nero, as he uses his swanky demon arm to beat the hell out of a demon invasion in the castle town of Fortuna.
Platform(s): Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 Games Store, PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4

Descritpion: A third-person hack 'n' slash action game best known for enabling the player to use a variety of different sword swings to chop off limbs, heads and arms of opponents.

An action platform game starring Donald Duck.
Platform(s): PlayStation 2, PlayStation, GameCube, Dreamcast, Nintendo 64, Game Boy Color, PC

Descritpion: Disney's Hercules is a movie based action game for the PlayStation and PC. In it, the player takes control of Hercules, who must complete various feats in order to be admitted into Olympus and sit alongside the gods.

DJ Boy is a side-scrolling Beat 'em up, released in 1989 by Kaneko for the Arcade, and later, Genesis. The game features a uniquely Japanese take on mid-to-late 80s Hip-hop/Urban culture. You play as DJ Boy, a rollerskater hoping to win the "Rollergame" fight-race competition in Cigaretch city.

Dokuro is a a 2D puzzle platformer for the PlayStation Vita where, as the titular skeletal hero Dokuro, you must escort the princess through myriad traps and obstacles using your chalk powers and ability to transform into a handsome prince.
A clone of Donkey Kong for the Welsh made Dragon32/64 computer and the Tandy CoCo.
Donkey Kong Classics is an early NES compilation cartridge featuring both the original Donkey Kong, and Donkey Kong Jr.
Double Dragon is a game credited, in part, with the popularity of the beat-em-up genre in the arcade craze of the 1980s and 1990s.

Descritpion: A monster collecting, breeding, and fighting game for the Game Boy Color. Terry's sister has been kidnapped and he must find and save her at any cost.

Known as the granddaddy of the "Quick Time Event", Dragon's Lair is an interactive cartoon that lets players help guide the actions of brave knight Dirk the Daring, as he ventures through the dangerous castle of Singe the Dragon in order to rescue his beloved princess Daphne.

Descritpion: Elite Beat Agents is a rhythm game for the Nintendo DS developed by iNiS Corp. and published by Nintendo. It is a spiritual sequel to the Japanese only Osu! Tatakae! Ouendan, and uses many of the same touch screen based gameplay mechanics.
You must find your way out of Hell in this, the last game to use the game engine created for Wasteland.

Video Game: Escape from the Planet of the Robot Monsters
Descritpion: Lots of beautiful girls have been abducted to Planet X and are being forced to create an evil robot army by the evil reptilions. It's your job as a member of the interplanetary SWAT team, to power up your laser pistols and save the world.

Descritpion: Esper Dream is a role-playing game developed and published by Konami for the Famicom Disk System and Wii Virtual Console platforms. It is the first game in the Esper Dream series.
Guide your fairy through a labyrinth and rescue a princess in this homebrew game.
Fallout 2 is the sequel to the critically acclaimed post-apocalyptic RPG.

The controversial Fat Princess sees the endless battle of red vs. blue comes to a fight between two kingdoms who have kidnapped each other's princess and are stuffing her with cake to make her rescue more difficult.

Descritpion: Final Fantasy VIII featured many new ideas for the Final Fantasy franchise, including: a subplot with a different main character, more realistic character designs, level-scaled enemy encounters, and the replacement of MP and most equipment with a system of card drawing and junctioning.
Final Fight is a classic beat-em-up game developed by Capcom featuring a memorable cast of characters including the first and only mustachioed ex pro-wrestler turned mayor, Mike Haggar.

Descritpion: Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance serves as the first incarnation of the Fire Emblem franchise to embrace the realm of the third dimension while continuing the series' focus on turn based combat in a medieval setting.
Side-scrolling shooter staring Newton the Flying Hamster.

Descritpion: After the end of the world, a young boy explores a deserted Tokyo, searching for other people who still live in the dead world, as well as trying to find out what exactly caused the end of society as we know it.
A puzzle game in which you control a robot with an afro.
Ganso Jajamaru-kun is an enhanced remake of the original Jajamaru-kun game
The first RPG to ever be released on the Super Famicom, which is loosely based on an anime OVA of the same name.
Ghouls 'n Ghosts is an action-platformer where Knight Arthur sets out on a quest to rescue captured souls from Lucifer (Loki). Ghouls 'n Ghosts is the sequel to Ghost'n Goblins.

Descritpion: Take control of one of three radically different factions and lay waste to your enemies with advanced technology, powerful magic, or raw brute strength.
Ginga Ninkyouden is an action-brawler from Jaleco. It is known for its many (unlicensed?) cameos from throughout Japanese pop culture.
Golden Axe III is the third game in the Golden Axe line of fantasy beat 'em ups.
The final game in the Deponia trilogy.
Guacamelee! is a side-scrolling Metroidvania style game featuring a luchador on a quest through dual worlds to save El Presidente's daughter.

Descritpion: Hugo must risk life and limb in a dangerous jungle to save the lovely Penelope from a poisonous death.

Hugo's House of Horrors is a classic DOS adventure game developed by Gray Design Associates. After the beautiful Penelope is kidnapped by fiendish ghouls and taken to a haunted house, her boyfriend Hugo must enter the spooky home and rescue her!
As Quasimodo, the hunchback of Notre-Dame, players must ring bells while avoiding myriad obstacles.

Descritpion: Omega Force, Team Ninja and Nintendo team up for this crossover between the Zelda franchise and the long-running Warriors hack-n-slash series. The game pits Link and friends against hordes of familiar enemies in the signature Warriors fashion.

Video Game: Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis
Descritpion: Indiana Jones follows an ancient medallion around the world to discover the secret of Atlantis before the Nazis can wield its terrible power in this classic LucasArts point-and-click adventure.

A light-hearted FPS for DOS, in which the player must adventure across an island as protagonist Dick Danger to rescue their girlfriend, Samantha "Sweet-Cheeks" Smith, from an antagonist known as "Evil Boss".
Jackie Chan's Action Kung Fu is an action game released by and developed by Hudson Soft for the Nintendo Entertainment System featuring the famous martial artist Jackie Chan

Jazz Jackrabbit is a platform game developed by Epic MegaGames (now known as Epic Games). It was released in 1994 for the PC. Jazz Jackrabbit was created by Cliff Bleszinski and Arjan Brussee, and inspired by classic console games such as Super Mario Bros and Sonic The Hedgehog.
A downloadable remake of Karateka; developed by the original creator Jordan Mechner, alongside Liquid Entertainment.
Platform(s): Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, iPhone, iPad

Descritpion: Kid Icarus is a 2D platformer released on the Nintendo Entertainment System, famed for its blending together of elements from The Legend of Zelda, Super Mario Bros. and Metroid.

Descritpion: King Kong 2: Ikari no Megaton Punch (怒りのメガトンパンチ/Megaton Punch of Fury) was only released in Japan for the Famicom. It is very loosely based off of the 1986 film King Kong Lives.
King's Knight is a top-down vertically-scrolling shooter and was the first North American release under the Squaresoft label.
Platform(s): MSX, Nintendo Entertainment System, Wii Shop

Video Game: King's Quest II: Romancing the Throne
Descritpion: After seeing a damsel in distress in a magic mirror, King Graham sets out on a quest to find her.
Platform(s): Amiga, Apple II, Atari ST, Apple IIgs, PC

Descritpion: To Heir is Human is the third title in Sierra-Online's King's Quest series. The story has moved away from King Graham and onto the adventures of Gwydion and follows his quest to return to Daventry.

Video Game: King's Quest V: Absence Makes the Heart Go Yonder
Descritpion: The evil wizard Mordack has taken the castle and royal family of Daventry, and are holding them prisoner. As the only member of the royal family left behind, King Graham must help his family and return the castle.
Platform Manufacturer(s): Commodore, Apple, Nintendo, PC, Fujitsu, NEC
Platform(s): Amiga, Mac, Nintendo Entertainment System, PC, FM Towns, NEC PC-9801

Video Game: King's Quest VI: Heir Today, Gone Tomorrow
Descritpion: Cassima's trapped in the castle and needs your help.
A unique mix of Disney and Square Enix characters join spiky-haired hero Sora on his epic journey to save multiple worlds from the evil of the Heartless and find his lost friends Riku and Kairi.
Developers: Squaresoft, Disney Interactive, Square Visual Works

Descritpion: Kingdom Hearts II is the third installment in the Kingdom Hearts franchise following after Kingdom Hearts: Chain of Memories, known for its successful combination of Disney and Final Fantasy franchises into a believable plot.
Kong (also known popularly as "Kong 64") is a Donkey Kong clone for Commodore 64. It is infamous for its bizarre cover art.

Help Thomas save his girlfriend, Sylvia, as he battles minions and dragons over five side-scrolling, action packed levels, Kung-Fu style. Based on the Jackie Chan movie Wheels on Meals, Kung-Fu Master (Spartan X in Japan) is often credited for creating the beat 'em up genre.

Descritpion: L.A. Noire is a detective thriller developed by Team Bondi in Australia and published by Rockstar Games.
Platform(s): Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC

Descritpion: Laplace no Ma (literally "Laplace's Demon") is a Japanese video game released in 1987. You must investigate the death of two boys who were found near the entrance of a mansion.
Platform(s): Super Nintendo Entertainment System, TurboGrafx-CD, Neo Geo CD, PC, NEC PC-8801, NEC PC-9801

Descritpion: In the deliberately offensive Lesbian Spider-Queens of Mars you take the role as the titular evil Queen with the mission to recapture your freed slaves.
Help Hipopo save his friends from the clutches of the Fire Devil!
Lock's Quest is a tower defense game for the NDS from 5th Cell Media, featuring real-time strategy, RPG and action game mechanics.
Lunar 2: Eternal Blue Complete is the sequel to Lunar: Sliver Star Story. The game features a brand new cast of characters and takes place 1000 years after the events of the original game.
Lunar: Eternal Blue follows the story of Hiro and Ruby as they attempt to help the Blue Star inhabitant Lucia finish her 'mission'.
Developers: Game Arts, Studio Alex, Vanguard Works

Descritpion: A remake of Lunar: The Silver Star on the PSP.
A young boy and his friends must embark on an epic journey of friendship and love across the planet of Lunar.
The first game in the Lunar series, and the second highest selling Sega CD game of all time, Lunar tells a story of love, betrayal, and redemption.

MadWorld is an artistically stylized over the top action game for the Wii created by Platinum Games. The main character, Jack, must compete in a kill or be killed TV show called Death Watch and gains points for the most brutal kills he can pull off.

Maniac Mansion is a graphic adventure game originally released in 1987 by Lucasfilm Games. When the innocent Sandy is kidnapped by the maniacal Dr. Fred, it's up to her boyfriend Dave and his friends to her from certain death!
Platform(s): Amiga, Apple II, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System, PC

Descritpion: The fourth entry in the Mario and Luigi RPG series has Mario traversing dreams within Luigi's mind. Players will have to interact with Luigi on the bottom screen to provoke certain events within his dreams.

Video Game: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Mini-Land Mayhem
Descritpion: Control a cadre of Mario miniatures to battle Mario's nemesis, Donkey Kong. It's more focused on creating a path this time.
An unlicensed NES game known mainly for being converted and rereleased as a Christian game under the title Sunday Funday.
A puzzle game where you move tiles to push enemies into walls and blocks. Beware the dreaded respawn tile!
Originally titled Metal Gear Solid: Ghost Babel, Metal Gear Solid is a Game Boy Color spinoff of the popular stealth action game, Metal Gear Solid.

Video Game: Metal Gear Solid: Digital Graphic Novel
Descritpion: A collection of Metal Gear Solid comics released as a PSP game. The comics are presented along with music, sound effects, limited animation, and some interactive elements.

Video Game: Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes
Descritpion: Remake of the acclaimed PlayStation stealth-action action title Metal Gear Solid, developed under supervision of creator Hideo Kojima and legendary Nintendo game designer Shigeru Miyamoto.
Theme: Sci-Fi, Espionage, Modern Military, Martial Arts

Descritpion: A Donkey Kong clone for CoCo and Dragon.
A platformer released for the NES late in the system's lifespan. It has gained a cult following thanks to its meticulously designed world and challenging gameplay.
This action RPG for the PlayStation 2 is the sequel to Square's Brave Fencer Musashi. Musashi is summoned once again to save the world from the growing threat posed by Gandrake Enterprises.
Be a hero in this rudimentary brawler from Sega, which challenges players to beat up foes using jump kicks and glass bottles in order to save your girl.
Mystic Ark is the spiritual successor to The 7th Saga, you play as a mute hero finding their way back to their own world.
Nanobreaker is a hack-and-slash game set in an apocalyptic future populated by "Orgamechs" and is most notably known for the copious amount of blood spilled during combat.
8-bit NES classic games with new twists and challenges.
Mario must use all of his abilities as well as several new power ups to rescue Princess Peach from the clutches of Bowser Junior in the first Super Mario Bros. game for the DS.

Video Game: Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos
Descritpion: The sequel to Tecmo's action packed platformer, Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos improves upon the gameplay concept of the original by adding new features like the ability to scale walls and to create Shadow Clones.
Platform(s): Nintendo Entertainment System, Wii Shop, PC, Nintendo 3DS eShop

Descritpion: A compilation of the first three Ninja Gaiden titles. This version features updated visuals and music with certain drawbacks and limitations, including non-configurable controls.

Nosferatu has taken Kyle's girlfriend and now she must be rescued before her soul sinks into darkness. Kyle will have to battle his way through the castle of the wicked vampire to and save his beloved Erin.
In Onimusha: Warlords you follow the young samurai Samanosuke as he explores Inabayama Castle searching for Princess Yuki.

The second Mario themed RPG, Bowser has stolen the Star Rod and has now has near limitless power. Mario goes on a quest to save the Seven Star Spirits, and retrieve the Star Rod from Bowser in order to save Princess Peach and the Mushroom Kingdom.

In his second paper-themed adventure, Mario must once again rescue the captured princess while he foils the X-Nauts' plans. The Thousand-Year Door features a turn-based battle system with real-time elements.

It's a race to save the penguin princess in this speed-based platformer. Collect fish and trade for items, navigate obstacles, fight massive bosses, and help Pentarou deliver the golden apple to cure the princess in this sequel to Antarctic Adventure.

Video Game: Peter Jackson's King Kong: The Official Game of the Movie
Descritpion: When the beautiful Ann Darrow is kidnapped by the inhabitants of Skull Island, Jack and his team must fight their way through the island's prehistoric inhabitants and hostile environments, solving puzzles and fending off attackers, all in search of her. But unfortunately for them, so is a giant ape.
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 2, Xbox 360, GameCube, Xbox, Nintendo DS, Xbox 360 Games Store, PC

Video Game: Peter's Quest: For The Love of Daphne
Descritpion: An obscure platformer for the Amiga. Players control peter on his quest through 20 levels in which he much collect hearts to save his girlfriend Daphne.
The only game ever to combine RPG-like character development and.... pinball?!
Every third round, Olive needs rescuing
Platform Manufacturer(s): Commodore, Nintendo, Coleco Industries, Texas Instruments, Mattel, Magnavox, Atari, Arcade
Platform(s): Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System, Atari 8-bit, Atari 2600, ColecoVision, TI-99/4A, Intellivision, Odyssey 2, Atari 5200, Arcade

Descritpion: Aliens turned Tommy's world upside down. It's about time he returned the favor.
Prince of Persia is the original Persian adventure by Jordan Mechner and the first game in a multi-million dollar franchise.
Platform Manufacturer(s): Amstrad, Atari, Commodore, Sinclair Research, Apple, Nintendo, Sega, NEC, PC

Descritpion: A remake of the first Prince of Persia, the player controls the Prince as he attempts to save the Princess from the evil Vizier Jaffar.

Descritpion: Choose between four unique classes to protect your princess from invading monster in this Ancient developed 8-bit throwback action game for Xbox Live Indie Games.
The Homeworld has been invaded by the Edgezone terrorists and it is up to Ranger X to save the day!
In 2010, catastrophe strikes the city of Del Ray as the levees that protect the municipality fail and the Cascade Lake begins to drown the city.
An adult RPG about a man named George who travels through six different worlds in order to find his fiancée, who was captured by mechanical beasts called "Steroids".
Platform(s): MSX, Sharp X68000, NEC PC-8801, NEC PC-9801

Descritpion: Help to repair the damage done to the world and repel an evil pirate invasion in this critically acclaimed platforming adventure.

Descritpion: Red Steel was one of the initial First Person Shooters available for the Wii at the system's launch, and one of the first games to make significant use of the Wii's motion-sensitive hardware.
A port compilation including HD versions of Resident Evil 4 and Resident Evil Code: Veronica.
Jet Li stars as police officer Kit Yun as he fights his way from Hong Kong to San Francisco to fulfill a dead man's wish.
Don your jetpack and take the fight to the surprisingly Nazi-like aliens who have invaded the Earth in this 1988 NES classic.
Platform(s): Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System, Apple IIgs, PC

Descritpion: Like a combination of Sonic the Hedgehog and the Tazmanian Devil, Rocky Rodent is another drop in the "Mascots with Attitude" bucket.
A 3D character action game for the PS2 that reimagines the 2D sidescroller Rygar.

Video Game: Samurai Warrior: The Battles of Usagi Yojimbo
Descritpion: Samurai Warrior was a computer game based on the Usagi Yojimbo comic book.
Platform(s): Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum

Descritpion: A modern expansion of the Metroidvania concept, Shadow Complex is a downloadable side-scrolling action-adventure platformer (for the Xbox 360) set in the near future, where reluctant hero Jason Fleming must investigate a mysterious and dangerous organization to rescue his new girlfriend.

Platform(s): Amiga, Genesis, Atari ST, Sega CD, FM Towns

Descritpion: As demon hunter Garcia "F**king" Hotspur, players must venture into Hell itself in order to rescue Paula, Garcia's innocent girlfriend, from the sadistic torments of Fleming, the Lord of Demons.
A fantasy adventure game where a regular college student is drawn into the world of Konami's Knightmare series.

1979 arcade shooter by Nintendo where the player must fight sixteen surrounding desperadoes. A precursor to Donkey Kong, it was designed by Genyo Takeda, with assistance from Shigeru Miyamoto, working on his first video game. Possibly the first run & gun shooter, it also introduced the damsel-in-distress trope to gaming as well as continuous background music.
The demon lord Zeon has been set free by an unwitting thief. It is the job of Bowie, a young hero from the Kingdom of Granseal, to lead the Shining Force to victory in this Tactical RPG from Sega.

Remake of the original Sid Meier's pirates, placing you in the role of a pirate searching for his kidnapped family. Battle rival pirates on the high seas and command an ever-growing crew of pirates as you work towards becoming a legendary pirate.
Genre: Strategy, Role-Playing, Simulation, Real-Time Strategy, Action, Adventure
Platform(s): Mac, PlayStation Portable, Xbox, Wii, PC, iPhone, iPad, Windows Phone
Developers: Firaxis Games, Full Fat Productions, Virtuos

Descritpion: A platform adventure game for the PlayStation Network and PC.
Step into the shoes of the young hero David to rescue the abducted women of Jarrah, including David's wife, Jennifer, from the evil fangs of the malicious sorcerer known as Silver.
A skateboarding game released for the original Game Boy that featured side-scrolling/top-down platforming action.
A simple SNES platform game in which the player has been transformed into a blue ball and must embark on a journey to stop an evil witch.
Smurf: Rescue in Gargamel's castle puts eveyone's favorite Belgium woodland creature in a daring adventure where he must jump over fences in search of Smurfette.
A superhero brawler franchise developed by Taito for the Arcades before moving to the SNES.

Sonic the Hedgehog's sole adventure for the Sega CD, as he travels through time to save the fate of Little Planet from Dr. Robotnik's army of robots (including Sonic's new adversary: his metallic doppelganger).
Platform Manufacturer(s): Sega, Microsoft, Sony, PC, Apple, Android, Ouya
Platform(s): Sega CD, Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, iPhone, iPad, Android, Windows Phone, Ouya

Descritpion: A Laserdisc-based animated reaction game. Space Ace must save his girlfriend, Kimberly from the evil alien, Borf in this follow up to Dragon's Lair.
Platform Manufacturer(s): Commodore, 3DO, Phillips, Atari, Sega, Arcade, Sony, PC, Apple, Nintendo, RDI Video Systems
Platform(s): Amiga, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Atari ST, Commodore 64, 3DO, CD-i, Jaguar, Sega CD, Wii, Arcade, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, iPhone, DSiWare, RDI Halcyon

Descritpion: Sort of a spin-off game to the Genesis game known as Rocket Knight Adventures. A Genesis game was released at the same time but was a more direct sequel.
As a brave, but fragile adventurer, explore dangerous procedurally-generated caves to collect treasure and gain better equipment, before dying horribly and starting all over again.
Platform(s): Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, PlayStation Network (Vita), PlayStation 4

Descritpion: A game based on Marvel's superhero and on the first movie of the Spider-Man franchise. It also featured many villains that did not appear in the movie.
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, PlayStation 2, GameCube, Xbox, PC
Developers: Digital Eclipse Software, Treyarch, Westlake Interactive

Platform(s): Neo Geo, Arcade, Wii Shop, Zeebo

Descritpion: Splatterhouse revisits Rick Taylor as he tries to rescue his girlfriend Jennifer from the evil clutches of Dr. West. In the process, he must battle against evil beings known as the "Corrupted" in bloody and brutal combat.
Sqrxz must rescue his girlfriend from the forces of evil in this third outing from Retroguru.
Platform Manufacturer(s): Commodore, Apple, Sega, PC, GamePark, Linux
Platform(s): Amiga, Mac, Dreamcast, PC, GamePark 32, Linux

Descritpion: Rare's last game for a major Nintendo console, Star Fox Adventures is a spin-off action-adventure game (in the Star Fox series of shooters) starring Fox McCloud, who must find a way to save the aptly-named Dinosaur Planet from destruction.
Sequel to the classic action-platformer Ghouls 'N Ghosts, once again sending Arthur on a brutally difficult quest.
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, PlayStation, Saturn, Wii Shop

Descritpion: A remake of the original Nintendo 64 classic, Super Mario 64 DS adds 30 new stars, three new playable characters and 36 mini-games utilizing the touch screen.

Focusing on a humble plumber and his brother setting out to rescue a Princess who has been kidnapped by a vile lizard king, Super Mario Bros. is a platformer created by Shigeru Miyamoto, published by Nintendo, and is one of the best selling video games of all time.
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, Nintendo Entertainment System, Wii Shop, Famicom Disk System, Nintendo 3DS eShop, Wii U

Video Game: Super Mario Bros. 3: Super Mario Advance 4
Descritpion: Super Mario Advance 4 is the Game Boy Advance remake of Super Mario Bros. 3 on the NES.
Princess Daisy of Sarasaland has been kidnapped by the evil alien Tatanga and it's up to Mario to rescue her in this handheld platformer (and launch title) for the original Game Boy.

Video Game: Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars
Descritpion: Join Mario in his first RPG adventure! Explore new and previously unseen areas of the Mushroom Kingdom on a quest to stop the mechanical Smithy on a path of conquest in this collaboration between Square and Nintendo.
Platform(s): Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Wii Shop

Descritpion: Peach, as usual...
When his beloved Bandage Girl is kidnapped by the evil Dr. Fetus, the diminutive yet plucky Meat Boy springs into action!
Strap on your fighting shoes and get ready to brawl in the first Smash Bros. game for the Wii. Super Smash Bros. Brawl is one of the best-selling Wii games, selling over 4.85 million units worldwide.
Developers: Sora, Game Arts, Toylogic, Paon Corporation, Monolith

Descritpion: Superfrog is a high production value, side scrolling platformer with elements taken from many other games from the same genre including Mario and Sonic the Hedgehog.
Kate Walker, a successful lawyer, travels to find Hans, the sole heir to a factory and eventually ends up on a journey to find him and the once thought to be extinct Mammoths.
Platform(s): PlayStation 2, Xbox, Nintendo DS, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, Android

Video Game: Takahashi Meijin no Bouken Jima IV
Descritpion: Last Adventure Island game for NES.

Tales of Legendia is the second full 3D game of the Tales Series. It follows Senel Coolidge and his sister Shirley, who get into a shipwreck and get stuck on a huge boat called the Legacy. Throughout the game you meet several different characters that will join your party.

Video Game: Tales of Monkey Island Chapter 1: Launch of the Screaming Narwhal
Descritpion: Telltale resurrects the much-loved pirate adventure franchise with Tales of Monkey Island, a five-part episodic series continuing the adventures of Guybrush Threepwood, this being the first.
Platform(s): Mac, Wii Shop, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, iPhone, iPad

Descritpion: Tales of Rebirth is the sixth main entry of Namco's Tales series of video games. Tales of Rebirth is set in a world where humans (called Humas) and Gajumas (beast people) coexist in relative peace.Rebirth breaks slightly from the series with a new take on the Linear Motion Battle System, the so-called "Three-Line Linear Motion" system. The player's characters and enemies are placed on three different planes and the player has the ability to switch between these planes during battle.

Tales of Symphonia is a cel-shaded action RPG and is another game in Namco's Tales series. It expands upon the series' battle system and emphasizes on relationships with other characters by the decisions you make throughout the game.
Tales of the Abyss is the eighth main game in the Tales series.
Tales of Vesperia is a Japanese Role-Playing Game and the first entry in the long-running "Tales of" franchise on seventh-generation consoles.

The first Tenchu game to arrive on the Nintendo Wii, Tenchu: Shadow Assassins is the fourth game in the main series. Players once again reprise the roles of Rikimaru and Ayame in this stealth ninja action game.
The Adventures of Bayou Billy is an action game released for the NES by Konami. The game is primarily a side-scrolling beat-em-up, but it also includes driving and shooting segments.

Based on the novel and movie, The Black Cauldron was a graphical adventure game developed by veteran game designer Al Lowe and published by Sierra Entertainment. The game was notable for utilizing function keys instead of the common text parser system.
Platform(s): Amiga, Apple II, Atari ST, Apple IIgs, PC

Descritpion: Squaresoft's first PS2 release, The Bouncer is a beat'em up that features RPG mechanics and a branching story path. It tells the tale of three bouncers that fight to rescue a girl from the clutches of a megalomaniacal CEO. The game was known for its production values, introducing a juggling physics engine and graphical techniques such as bloom lighting and depth-of-field effects.
Developers: Dream Factory, Squaresoft, Square EA, Square Visual Works

Descritpion: On his 21st birthday, Jackie Estacado gets possessed by an entity known as The Darkness. After getting into trouble with the Mafia, Jackie finds himself on the run, trying to protect the people most important to him.

Video Game: The Denpa Men: They Came By Wave
Descritpion: A dungeon crawler with nods to Pikmin, Dragon Quest and Pokemon. Use the 3DS camera to capture Denpa Men to build your party.

Video Game: The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky
Descritpion: The first game in the Legend of Heroes VI Sora no Kiseki trilogy. Follow Estelle and Joshua Bright on their journey to become Senior Bracers.
Platform(s): PlayStation Portable, PlayStation 3, PC, PlayStation Network (PSP), PlayStation Vita, PlayStation Network (Vita)

Descritpion: A young boy explores a huge overworld filled with enemies and dungeons to find and rescue Princess Zelda from the evil Ganon.
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, Nintendo Entertainment System, Wii Shop, Famicom Disk System, Nintendo 3DS eShop, Wii U

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda Wii U (Working Title)
Descritpion: The first original installment of the Zelda series in HD on the Wii U goes back to open world design with a focus on free exploration of a large scale environment and dangerous enemies.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds
Descritpion: The first original The Legend of Zelda game on the Nintendo 3DS and also a direct sequel to The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past set six generations after.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
Descritpion: The third installment in the Zelda series makes a return to the top-down 2D gameplay found in the first game. This time around, Link needs to travel between the light and dark world in order to set things straight in the kingdom of Hyrule.
Platform(s): Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Wii Shop, Wii U

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past & Four Swords
Descritpion: A Game Boy Advance remake of the SNES classic featuring an all new Four Swords multiplayer component.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Four Swords Adventures
Descritpion: Create four-player mayhem to either vanquish the evil hordes of Vaati, or to blast each other into submission using the GBA link cable.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time
Descritpion: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time is considered to be one of the greatest games of all time, due in large part to the seamless unity between traditional Zelda gameplay and the bold, artistic, 3D environment in which it is presented.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time 3D
Descritpion: The Hero of Time's classic adventure gets a 3D makeover in Ocarina of Time 3D, a fully remastered and enhanced handheld version of one of the highest rated video games of all time. Also includes a mirrored version of Ocarina of Time: Master Quest, originally only available in limited quantities for the GameCube.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Ages
Descritpion: One of a pair of Zelda games released simultaneously for the Game Boy Color. Oracle of Ages gives Link the ability to travel through time.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Seasons
Descritpion: The Legend of Zelda: Oracle of Seasons is one of the two Oracle games released on the Game Boy Color. It featured the ability to change the four seasons as Link went on a quest to save the Oracle of Seasons, Din.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Phantom Hourglass
Descritpion: The first Zelda handheld game developed by Nintendo EAD since Link's Awakening, the game continues the story of Link and his Pirates to find a new Hyrule, but are detoured by a Ghost Ship. Controlled entirely by Touch Screen, it is one of the best selling games in the series.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Skyward Sword
Descritpion: Link descends from his floating continent home to explore the dark and dangerous world below with the help of a magical sword, in this latest instalment of the Legend of Zelda series.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Spirit Tracks
Descritpion: Set 100 years after the events of The Wind Waker and Phantom Hourglass, Spirit Tracks introduces a new Hyrule where technology has advanced to the steam age, and an evil force, long-sealed in a tower, has been freed.

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: The Minish Cap
Descritpion: Link dons a talking hat named Ezlo as he sets out on a quest to save Princess Zelda and defeat the evil wizard Vaati.
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, Nintendo 3DS eShop, Wii U

Video Game: The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess
Descritpion: Link must rescue Zelda in TP
One of the first action RPGs, The Magic of Scheherazade was a Culture Brain title for the NES (1989) and Famicom (1987, as Arabian Dream Scheherazade).
Developers: Culture Brain, Micro Academy, Culture Brain

Descritpion: Play through the events of all three Matrix films as Neo, with an alternate ending written by the Wachowski brothers.

Video Game: The Powerpuff Girls: Defenders of Townsville
Descritpion: A Powerpuff Girls "metroidvania" style action game from Radiangames.
Shoot cowboys, robots, gangsters, and zombies, while trying to impress your fickle director in this rail shooter for the PlayStation Move.

Platform(s): Game Boy, Genesis, Sega Master System, Nintendo Entertainment System

Descritpion: The Stooges must save their fiancees from a mad scientist in this arcade game.
Players climb the tower, defeat Druaga and rescue Princess Ki in this maze-style action role-playing game from Namco.
Platform(s): Game Boy, MSX, Nintendo Entertainment System, TurboGrafx-16, Arcade, Wii Shop, Nintendo 3DS eShop

Descritpion: Thousand Arms is a JRPG game with dating sim elements. Help Meis Triumph upgrade his weapons by combining love and a red hot forge. Don't forget to use said weapons to destroy the evil robotic Dark Acolytes.
TimeSplitters 2 is a frantic rush through time to rescue the Time Crystals from the evil TimeSplitters, who would like nothing more than to end mankind's existence.
Theme: Sci-Fi, Alternate Historical, Comedy, Modern Military, Crime, Mayan

Descritpion: A platformer developed by TAD Corporation.
Platform(s): Amiga, Genesis, Atari Lynx, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Nintendo Entertainment System, Arcade
Developers: Tad Corporation, Ocean Software, Atari, Taito Corporation, Megasoft

Descritpion: A young and inexperienced Lara Croft is shipwrecked on a mysterious island in an open world action-adventure game, departing from the mood of prior games in the series.
Platform(s): Mac, Xbox 360, PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 Games Store, PlayStation Network (PS3), PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4
Developers: Crystal Dynamics, Eidos, Nixxes Software, United Front Games, Square Visual Works

Descritpion: A sequel to the original Tomba!, Tomba! 2 is a platformer adventure game released for the PlayStation in 1999.
A totally righteous dude, Jake, has to save his righteous babe, Allison, from the evil Edogy in this extremely 80's NES game.
Trampoline Terror! Is a platform game that involves loads of floating trampolines and one gymnast who must save the princess from a destructive evil empire.
Activision's open world adventure game puts you in the role of an undercover Los Angeles Cop.
True Lies is a game based off the action film of the same name starring Arnold Schwarzeneggar where he is trying to get to the bottom of a terrorist organization.
Platform(s): Game Boy, Game Gear, Genesis, Super Nintendo Entertainment System

Descritpion: Two Worlds is an Action Role Playing Game in which you explore the world of Antaloor, solving quests and making choices that affect the world around you.

A horror-themed point-and-click adventure game that centers around the loss of a sibling and other supernatural occurrences. It was one of the original MacVenture games, along with Deja Vu and Shadowgat
Platform(s): Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, Mac, Nintendo Entertainment System, Apple IIgs, PC

Descritpion: Among one of the first tactical role-playing games to land on western shores, Vandal Hearts follows the trials and triumphs of Ash Lambert, and the oppressive conflict that threatens all of Sostegaria.

On the day of his wedding, the prince's bride is kidnapped by a battalion of flying robots. The prince sets off on a journey to reclaim his lost love and discover the meaning of the attack in this traditional turn-based RPG known for its stiff difficulty.
A beat-em-up where players control a martial artist who must rescue his girlfriend, Madonna.
Platform Manufacturer(s): Sega, Amstrad, Atari, Commodore, Microsoft, Sinclair Research, NEC, Arcade, Nintendo
Platform(s): Amiga, Sega Master System, Amstrad CPC, Atari ST, Commodore 64, MSX, ZX Spectrum, TurboGrafx-16, Arcade, Wii Shop

Descritpion: Wade, Boris, and Kyle star in this Final Fight clone from Konami.
Another installment in the Wai Wai World series. Once again a variety of Konami characters are playable.
Released in 1987, War of the Dead is considered to be the first true survival horror game. SWAT officer Lila must rescue survivors in the demon-infested small town of Chaney’s Hill.
Hop on platforms, solve puzzles, collect treasure, and beat baddies in the Wario Land series' first console iteration.
Will Rock must save his girlfriend from Zeus and his cronies in this fast-paced first-person shooter by Saber Interactive.
Winter Voices is an episodic adventure-RPG about a girl who has hallucinations after her father dies and is not sure of her place in the world. This is her quest.

Wizards & Warriors, developed by Rare Ltd., is the first in a trilogy of games for the NES. The game features a swordsman named Kuros saving a number of damsels in distress on his way to defeat the evil wizard Malkil.
WWF Betrayal was released for the Game Boy Color in 2001. Instead of mimicking pro wrestling, it featured WWE Superstars of that era in a side-scrolling beat 'em up.
3D action game based on the fantasy TV-series. Xena's best friend Gabrielle must be rescued from the magic citadel. Released only as PAL version for the PS2.
Control Xena in this video game adaptation of the popular television series. Use her Chakram to battle enemies in 3-D environments.
A side-scrolling space shooter that takes place in the post-apocalyptic setting of 2777. It was released on the NES by Hudson Soft and co-developed by Atlus.

Yakuza, known in Japan as Ryu ga Gotoku (Like a Dragon), is an open-world action-adventure game with RPG elements, developed and published by Sega, in which you play the role of a Yakuza gangster known as Kazuma Kiryu. It was released in 2005.
Falcom's re-imagining of Ys III for the PC and PSP.

Video Game: Zack & Wiki: Quest for Barbaros' Treasure
Descritpion: A Wii adventure game developed and published by Capcom, Zack and Wiki puts the player in the shoes of Zack, a boy who aspires to be the most successful pirate in history.

Video Game: Zelda II: The Adventure of Link
Descritpion: Zelda II: The Adventure of Link is the second entry in the ground-breaking Zelda franchise. This controversial follow-up ditches the original's top-down perspective for 2D side-scrolling exploration and combat. The 2D towns, dungeons and combat arenas are tied together by a top-down overworld.
Platform(s): Game Boy Advance, Nintendo Entertainment System, Wii Shop, Famicom Disk System, Nintendo 3DS eShop, Wii U
